is.hello.buruberi.bluetooth.stacks

Interface GattCharacteristic


  • public interface GattCharacteristic
    Represents a gatt characteristic from a GattService.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  GattCharacteristic.Permissions
      Marks an int as containing one of the permission constants from GattCharacteristic.
      static interface  GattCharacteristic.Properties
      Marks an int as containing one of the property constants from GattCharacteristic.

      • getDescriptorPermissions

        @GattCharacteristic.Permissions
int getDescriptorPermissions(java.util.UUID descriptor)
        Returns the permissions associated with a given descriptor.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - The descriptor identifier.
        Returns:
        The permissions of the descriptor if it can be found; 0 otherwise.

      • enableNotification

        rx.Observable<java.util.UUID> enableNotification(java.util.UUID descriptor,
                                                 OperationTimeout timeout)
        Enable notification events for a given descriptor.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - The descriptor to enable notifications for.
        timeout - The timeout to apply to the operation.
        Returns:
        The operation, waiting to be subscribed to.

      • disableNotification

                                                  OperationTimeout timeout)
        Disable notification events for a given descriptor.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - The descriptor to enable notifications for.
        timeout - The timeout to apply to the operation.
        Returns:
        The operation, waiting to be subscribed to.

      • write

        rx.Observable<java.lang.Void> write(GattPeripheral.WriteType writeType,
                                    byte[] payload,
                                    OperationTimeout timeout)
        Writes a given payload on the characteristic.

        Important: it appears on some devices that writes are asynchronous on multiple levels. Although the stack may report the write was successful, it doesn't mean the write has actually completed. If you're going to disconnect after a write operation, it's a good idea to add a delay of a few seconds.

        The value of writeType is supposed to be automatically inferred during service discovery, but some devices do not consistently populate the value (Verizon Note 4). As such, this value must be provided for every write command call.

        Parameters:
        writeType - The type of write to perform.
        payload - The payload to write. Must be 20 bytes or less.
        timeout - The timeout to wrap the operation within.
        Returns:
        An observable that will emit a single null value, then complete upon success.
